title: Equipment and Harvest Crew
description: Requirements for harvest equipment and crew hygiene including equipment sanitation procedures, cleaning schedules, harvest container management, and harvest crew hygiene practices

requirements.text: Are harvest equipment and harvest containers (bins, crates, bags, boxes, lugs, totes, etc.) maintained in a clean and sanitary condition?
mandatoryStatements: Harvest equipment is visibly clean and sanitary
Harvest containers are visibly clean and sanitary
Equipment and containers are inspected before use
Damaged or soiled containers are not used
Equipment is cleaned at appropriate intervals
Containers are cleaned between uses or are single-use
Cleaning procedures are documented
requirements.verificationExpectations: Daily pre-harvest inspection of equipment and containers
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Continuous monitoring during harvest, immediate removal of unclean equipment or containers

requirements.text: Are there documented cleaning and sanitizing procedures for harvest equipment and harvest containers?
mandatoryStatements: Written cleaning and sanitizing procedures exist
Procedures specify what equipment and containers to clean
Procedures specify cleaning frequency
Procedures specify cleaning methods and materials
Procedures specify sanitizing methods and concentrations if applicable
Procedures specify responsible personnel
Procedures are communicated and trained to relevant personnel
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual review of cleaning procedures for completeness
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Verify procedures are followed during cleaning activities

requirements.text: Are there records demonstrating that cleaning and sanitizing of equipment and harvest containers is occurring according to the documented procedures?
mandatoryStatements: Cleaning and sanitizing activities are documented
Records include date and time of cleaning
Records include identification of equipment/containers cleaned
Records include name of person performing cleaning
Records demonstrate frequency matches procedure requirements
Records include verification that cleaning was effective
Non-conformances are documented and corrected
requirements.verificationExpectations: Weekly review of cleaning records for completeness and compliance
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily recording of cleaning activities, immediate documentation of any cleaning issues

requirements.text: Is harvest equipment in good repair and maintained to minimize contamination risk?
mandatoryStatements: Harvest equipment is in good repair
No broken or damaged parts that contact product
Equipment surfaces are smooth and cleanable
Equipment does not have sharp edges or splinters
Equipment is maintained to prevent lubricant or fluid leaks onto product
Maintenance is performed regularly
Equipment is inspected before each use
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily pre-use inspection, immediate repair or replacement of damaged equipment

requirements.text: Are harvest containers stored in a manner that protects them from contamination?
mandatoryStatements: Harvest containers are stored off the ground
Containers are stored under cover or protected from weather
Storage area is clean and organized
Containers are stored to prevent pest access
Clean containers are separated from dirty containers
Storage area is away from contamination sources
Containers are inspected before use even if stored properly
requirements.verificationExpectations: Weekly inspection of container storage areas
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily verification of proper storage, immediate correction if contamination risk detected

requirements.text: Do harvest crew members follow hygiene requirements including hand washing, illness exclusion, and clean clothing?
mandatoryStatements: Harvest crew members wash hands before starting work
Harvest crew members wash hands after restroom use
Harvest crew members wash hands after breaks
Ill workers are excluded from harvest activities
Harvest crew wears clean clothing
Harvest crew follows jewelry restrictions
Hygiene rules are communicated and enforced
Supervisors monitor hygiene compliance
requirements.verificationExpectations: Daily observation of harvest crew hygiene practices
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Continuous supervision during harvest, immediate correction of violations

requirements.text: Have harvest crew members received food safety and hygiene training appropriate for their duties?
mandatoryStatements: Harvest crew receives food safety training before starting work
Training covers personal hygiene requirements
Training covers product handling requirements
Training covers illness reporting
Training is documented with records
Training is in language understood by workers
Refresher training is provided annually or as needed
Training effectiveness is assessed through observation
requirements.verificationExpectations: Quarterly audit of harvest crew training records
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Train all new harvest crew before work begins, annual refresher for returning workers

requirements.text: Are toilet and hand washing facilities adequate and accessible for harvest crew?
mandatoryStatements: Adequate toilet facilities are provided for harvest crew
Adequate hand washing facilities are provided
Facilities are located within reasonable distance of harvest areas
Facilities meet same requirements as field worker facilities (Section 2.07)
Facilities are maintained clean and stocked
Facility locations do not pose contamination risk
Additional mobile facilities provided if harvest crew is in remote areas
requirements.verificationExpectations: Daily inspection of harvest crew toilet and hand washing facilities
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Multiple daily checks during active harvest, immediate restocking and cleaning as needed

requirements.text: Is harvest equipment stored in a manner that protects it from contamination when not in use?
mandatoryStatements: Harvest equipment is stored in protected area when not in use
Equipment is stored off the ground
Equipment is covered or stored under shelter
Storage area is clean and away from contamination sources
Equipment is stored to prevent pest access
Equipment is inspected and cleaned before storage if appropriate
requirements.verificationExpectations: Weekly inspection of equipment storage practices
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily verification of proper storage after use

requirements.text: Are harvest crew personal items (food, beverages, cell phones, bags) prohibited from harvest areas?
mandatoryStatements: Personal items are prohibited in harvest areas
Designated areas provided for storage of personal items
Policy is communicated to harvest crew
Supervisors enforce prohibition
Violations result in corrective action
Drinking water is provided in designated areas outside harvest zone
requirements.verificationExpectations: Daily inspection of harvest areas for personal items
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Continuous supervision, immediate removal of personal items from harvest areas

capaInject: If equipment or containers not clean: immediately remove from use, clean and sanitize before returning to service
If cleaning procedures not documented: develop procedures within 7 days, implement immediately
If cleaning records not maintained: implement record keeping immediately, ensure daily documentation
If equipment in poor repair: immediate removal from service, repair or replace before use
If containers not stored properly: reorganize storage immediately, implement proper storage controls
If harvest crew not following hygiene: immediate retraining, enhanced supervision, disciplinary action for violations
If harvest crew training inadequate: provide comprehensive training immediately before continued harvest work
If toilet/hand wash facilities inadequate for harvest crew: provide additional facilities immediately
If equipment not stored properly: implement proper storage immediately after each use
If personal items in harvest areas: immediate removal, retrain workers, disciplinary action for repeat violations
traceabilityInject: Equipment cleaning records must be traceable to specific equipment, cleaning dates, and personnel
Harvest container cleaning records must be traceable to container types, cleaning events, and verification
Harvest crew training records must be traceable to specific crew members, training dates, and topics
Equipment maintenance records must be traceable to specific equipment, maintenance dates, and work performed
